Class IoUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.io.IoUtil
public final class IoUtil extends Object
Utility class for Input/Output.

    • getFilename

      public static String getFilename(String path)
      Extract the filename from a path given as a String. In addition to the system dependent File.separatorChar, the forward slash '/' is always considered a separator.
      Parameters:
      path - the path of the file
      Returns:
      the filename of the path's last element

      Returns:
      true if separator

    • getExtension

      public static String getExtension(String path)
      Get file extension.

      Note that trailing path separators are ignored. That means that both getExtension("test.txt") and getExtension("test.txt/") return `"txt"`.

      Parameters:
      path - the path
      Returns:
      the extension

    • stripExtension

      public static String stripExtension(String path)
      Remove file extension.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path
      Returns:
      filename without extension

    • replaceExtension

      public static String replaceExtension(String path, String extension)
      Replace file extension.

      If the filename doesn't have an extension, it will be appended.

      Parameters:
      path - the file path
      extension - the new file extension
      Returns:
      filename with replaced extension

    • replaceExtension

      Replace the file extension.

      If the filename doesn't have an extension, it will be appended.

      Parameters:
      path - the file path
      extension - the new file extension
      Returns:
      filename with replaced extension

    • loadText

      public static String loadText(Path path, Consumer<? super Charset> onCharsetDetected, Charset... charsets) throws IOException
      Load text with unknown character encoding. Tries to load text into a String. Several encodings are tried in the order given in the parameters to this method. On success, calls `onCharsetDetected` to report back the encoding and returns the text.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to load the text from
      onCharsetDetected - callback to inform about the detected encoding.
      charsets - the encodings to try
      Returns:
      the text read
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs during loading the data

    • loadText

      public static String loadText(Path path, Consumer<? super Charset> onCharsetDetected) throws IOException
      Load text with unknown character encoding. Tries to load text into a String. These encodings are tried sequentially: - UTF-8 - the default encoding for the platform - ISO 8859-1
      Parameters:
      path - the path to load the text from
      onCharsetDetected - callback to inform about the detected encoding.
      Returns:
      the text read
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs during loading the data

    • zip

      public static void zip(OutputStream out, Path root, String zipRoot, Stream<? extends Path> paths) throws IOException
      Compresses the given files and directories into a zip file and writes it to the specified output stream.
      Parameters:
      out - the output stream to write the zip data to
      root - the root directory for relative paths of files and directories
      zipRoot - the root directory within the zip file
      paths - the stream of paths to include in the zip file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during the compression process

    • unzip

      public static void unzip(URL zipUrl, Path destination) throws IOException
      Unzips the contents of a ZIP file to the specified destination directory. If the entry is a file, it will be extracted. If the entry is a directory, the directory will be created.

      This method uses default safety limits to protect against zip bombs and other malicious zip files. The default limits are:

      • Maximum number of files: 1000L
      • Maximum total bytes: 1000000000L
      • Maximum compression ratio: 100.0

      The implementation enforces these limits during streaming, without buffering the entire file content in memory. It also does not rely solely on the compressed size reported in the zip file, which can be spoofed in malicious zip files.

      Parameters:
      zipUrl - The URL of the ZIP file to unzip.
      destination - The destination directory where the contents will be extracted to.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading or writing the ZIP file.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the destination is not an existing directory.
      ZipException - if the extraction exceeds any of the safety limits.
      See Also:
      • unzip(URL, Path, long, long, double)

    • unzip

      public static void unzip(URL zipUrl, Path destination, long maxFiles, long maxBytes, double maxCompressionRatio) throws IOException
      Unzips the contents of a ZIP file to the specified destination directory with safety limits. If the entry is a file, it will be extracted. If the entry is a directory, the directory will be created.

      This method includes safety parameters to protect against zip bombs and other malicious zip files:

      • maxFiles: Maximum number of files to extract
      • maxBytes: Maximum total bytes to extract
      • maxCompressionRatio: Maximum allowed compression ratio

      The implementation enforces these limits during streaming, without buffering the entire file content in memory. It also does not rely solely on the compressed size reported in the zip file, which can be spoofed in malicious zip files.

      Parameters:
      zipUrl - The URL of the ZIP file to unzip.
      destination - The destination directory where the contents will be extracted to.
      maxFiles - The maximum number of files to extract.
      maxBytes - The maximum total bytes to extract.
      maxCompressionRatio - The maximum allowed compression ratio.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading or writing the ZIP file.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the destination is not an existing directory.
      ZipException - if the extraction exceeds any of the safety limits.

    • lexicalPathComparator

      public static Comparator<@Nullable Path> lexicalPathComparator(Locale locale)
      Creates a comparator that performs lexicographic comparison of Path instances based on the specified locale. The comparison considers the roots of the paths, followed by their individual path segments, in a lexicographic order determined by the given locale. Paths that are null are considered less than non-null paths.

      Note: The returned Comparator is not threadsafe.

      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to be used for lexicographic comparison of path names. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      a comparator that compares Path objects lexicographically based on their root and individual path segments, using the provided locale for ordering.

    • glob

      public static Stream<Path> glob(Path base, String pattern) throws IOException
      Generate a stream of paths matching a glob pattern. For details on pattern syntax refer to the PathMatcher documentation.

      The returned paths are Path objects that are obtained as if by resolving the relative path against base.

      Make sure to close the stream after processing!

      Parameters:
      base - the base directory
      pattern - the pattern
      Returns:
      stream of matching paths.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error is thrown when accessing the file system

    • findFiles

      public static List<Path> findFiles(Path base, String pattern) throws IOException
      Generate a list of paths matching a glob pattern, analogue to glob(Path, String).
      Parameters:
      base - the base directory
      pattern - the pattern
      Returns:
      stream of matching paths.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error is thrown when accessing the file system

    • createSecureTempDirectory

      public static Path createSecureTempDirectory(String prefix) throws IOException
      Creates a secure temporary directory with the given prefix.

      On non-POSIX systems like WINDOWS, no exception is thrown if permissions can not be set!

      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix for the name of the temporary directory
      Returns:
      the path to the newly created temporary directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, the temporary directory cannot be created or the permissions set.

    • createSecureTempDirectory

      public static Path createSecureTempDirectory(Path dir, String prefix) throws IOException
      Creates a secure temporary directory with specified permissions depending on the operating system.
      Parameters:
      dir - the path to the parent directory, may be null in which case the default temporary-file directory is used.
      prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the directory's name; may be a null string.
      Returns:
      the path to the created temporary directory.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, the temporary directory cannot be created or the permissions set.

    • createSecureTempDirectoryAndDeleteOnExit

      public static Path createSecureTempDirectoryAndDeleteOnExit(String prefix) throws IOException
      Creates a secure temporary directory and schedules it for deletion upon JVM exit.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the directory's name; may be null
      Returns:
      the path to the newly created temporary directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, the temporary directory cannot be created or the permissions set.

    • createSecureTempDirectoryAndDeleteOnExit

      public static Path createSecureTempDirectoryAndDeleteOnExit(Path dir, String prefix) throws IOException
      Creates a secure temporary directory and schedules it for deletion upon JVM exit.
      Parameters:
      dir - the parent directory in which the temporary directory is to be created, or null for the system default temporary directory
      prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the directory's name; may be null
      Returns:
      the path to the newly created temporary directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, the temporary directory cannot be created or the permissions set.

    • deleteRecursiveOnExit

      public static void deleteRecursiveOnExit(Path dir)
      Schedules the deletion of the specified directory and its contents when the JVM exits.
      Parameters:
      dir - the path of the directory to be deleted recursively on JVM exit

    • getApplicationDataDir

      public static Path getApplicationDataDir(String appName) throws IOException
      Ensures the existence of a data directory for the specified application. If the directory does not exist, it will be created.
      Parameters:
      appName - the name of the application for which the data directory is required
      Returns:
      the Path of the data directory
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the directory

    • getUserDir

      public static Path getUserDir()
      Retrieves the user's home directory as a Path. This method obtains the path to the user's home directory from the "user.home" system property. If the property is not set, it defaults to the current directory (".").
      Returns:
      a Path representing the user's home directory
